BUREAU OF CIVIL AVIATION SECURITY 
(MINISTRY OF CIVIL AVIATION) 
GOVERNMENT OF INDIA 
A WING , JANPATH  BHAWAN , 
JANPATH, NEW DELHI -110001 
Date   :     6.5.2005 
 
C I R C U L A R   16/ 2005 
 
1. 
The following aircraft operators shall establish, implement and maintain a written 
operator security programme which  meets the requirements of the national civil aviation 
security programme of the country: 
 
(a) 
all commercial air transport operators providing service to/ from India; 
(b) 
each entity conducting general aviation operations, including corporate aviation 
operations using aircraft with  a maximum take-off mass greater than 5700 kg.; 
and  
(c) 
each entity conducting the aerial work operations. The programme  shall  contain 
operational  features  specific  to the type  of  aeriel work operations  conducted. 
 
2. 
The format prescribed by ICAO vide Appendix 15 of ICAO Security Manual shall be 
utilized  by the aircraft operators for preparing their security programme. 
 
3. 
The aircraft operators, categorized in para -1 above,  who are already operating to/ from 
India and have not yet submitted their security programme shall submit their programme to the 
BCAS and get the same approved within three months time from issue of this Circular positively. 
 
4. 
The security programme shall be valid for a period of  5 years. However, the security 
programme shall be updated by the aircraft operators on the basis of security directives issued by 
the BCAS from time to time. After 5 years, a revised security programme shall be submitted by 
each aircraft operator  as mentioned in para 2 above to the BCAS for approval.  
 
5. 
The security programme shall be produced by the concerned aircraft operator to the 
BCAS officer during audit/ inspection.  
 
6. 
No aircraft operator, as mentioned in para-1 above, shall be allowed to operate to/ from 
India unless the security programme is approved by the Commissioner of Security(CA). 
 
7. 
The above instructions will come into force with immediate effect, and will remain so till 
further orders. 
 
 
(R.C. Tayal) 
Offg. Commissioner of Security (CA)
